Tag.description: You can use the Resource Tags property to apply tags to resources, which can help you identify and categorize those resources.

resource.description: The AWS::Timestream::Database resource creates a Timestream database.

properties.name: DatabaseName
properties.description: The name for the database. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates a unique physical ID and uses that ID for the database name.

type.description: The name for the database. If you don't specify a name, AWS CloudFormation generates a unique physical ID and uses that ID for the database name.

properties.name: KmsKeyId
properties.description: The KMS key for the database. If the KMS key is not specified, the database will be encrypted with a Timestream managed KMS key located in your account.

type.description: The KMS key for the database. If the KMS key is not specified, the database will be encrypted with a Timestream managed KMS key located in your account.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

type.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

attributes.description: The AWS::Timestream::Database resource creates a Timestream database.
